		Question: Which movie, starring Al Jolson, is generally considered to be the first talking picture?
		Answer:
answer:
The answer is: The Jazz Singer.

The Jazz Singer is a 1927 American musical film and the first full-length feature film to achieve widespread distribution with synchronized sound, including music and dialogue. The film was released by Warner Bros.

The Jazz Singer was a huge success, grossing nearly $26 million at the box office, more than any film in the world at the time. The Jazz Singer is considered one of the greatest films of all time, and is also
